get.description:
Basic information about the API
Basic information about the API, including the operating environment and the current git commit.

Redirect to the current git commit on GitHub
Redirects to the current git commit on GitHub.

Show API documentation
Show Swagger API documentation, generated from annotations in the running code.

post.description:
Echo the request back to the client
Echo the request back to the client, including the provided Token and associated User.

get.description:
Logout
Delete the OAuth Bearer Token provided in the Authorization header (e.g. to log out).

Echo a parsed User-Agent header
Echo a parsed User-Agent header.

List Content Authors
List content authors, for which contents exist.

List Content Editors
List content editors (IDs and names), for which contents exist.

parameters.description: Sort by Name? (not paginated; default: false)
parameters.name: sorted

get.description:
List Content Tags
List content tags, for which contents exist.

List Content Titles
List Content Titles by type, author, or tag, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.
Optionally, filter results with search terms.

parameters.description: Any Match? (default: false; all search terms must match)
parameters.name: any

parameters.description: Sort by Title? (not paginated; default: false)
parameters.name: sorted

get.description:
List Content Types
List content types, for which contents exist.

List Contents
List Contents, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.

post.description:
Create a new Content
Create a new unit of Content (Book, Chapter, Article, Category, etc.)

Location.description: URL of the newly created Content

get.description:
Get Content
Get Content by ID.

put.description:
Update Content
Update the provided, complete unit of Content.

delete.description:
Delete Content
Delete and return the specified Content.

head.description:
Content Exists
Check if the specified Content exists.

get.description:
Get Content Versions
Get Content Versions by ID, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.

Get Content Version
Get Content Version by ID and VersionID.

delete.description:
Delete Content Version
Delete and return the specified Content version.

head.description:
Content Version Exists
Check if the specified Content version exists.

get.description:
List Device IDs and UserAgents
List Device IDs and UserAgents, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.
Optionally, filter results with search terms.

parameters.description: Any Match? (default: false; all search terms must match)
parameters.name: any

parameters.description: Sort by UserAgent? (not paginated; default: false)
parameters.name: sorted

get.description:
Get Device Counts
Get a paginated list of device counts by date.

Get Device Count
Get the number of devices encountered on the specified date.

put.description:
Update Device Count
Update the number of devices encountered on the specified date.

head.description:
Device Count Exists
Check if the specified Device Count exists.

get.description:
Get Device Dates
Get a list of dates for which devices exist.

Get Device User IDs
Get a list of User IDs for which devices exist.

List Devices
List Devices, paging with reverse, limit, and offset. Optionally, filter by UserID or Date.

post.description:
Create a new Device
Create a new Device from a User-Agent header.

get.description:
Get Device
Get Device by ID.

put.description:
Update Device
Update the specified Device from a User-Agent header.

delete.description:
Delete Device
Delete and return the specified Device.

head.description:
Device Exists
Check if the specified Device exists.

get.description:
Get Device Versions
Get Device Versions by ID, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.

Get Device Version
Get Device Version by ID and VersionID.

delete.description:
Delete Device Version
Delete and return the specified Device Version.

head.description:
Device Version Exists
Check if the specified Device version exists.

get.description:
Get Email Addresses
Get a list of email addresses for which emails exist.

Get Email Statuses
Get a list of status codes for which emails exist.

List Emails
List Emails, paging with reverse, limit, and offset. Optionally, filter by email address or status.
Regular users can only list their own Emails. Administrators can list all Emails.

post.description:
Create/Send a new Email
Create and send a new Email message.

Location.description: URL of the newly created Email

get.description:
Get Email
Get Email by ID.

put.description:
Update/Send Email
Update the provided complete Email. If the status is PENDING, the Email is sent.

delete.description:
Delete Email
Delete and return the specified Email.

head.description:
Email Exists
Check if the specified Email exists.

get.description:
Get Email Versions
Get Email Versions by ID, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.

Get Email Version
Get Email Version by ID and VersionID.

head.description:
Email Version Exists
Check if the specified Email version exists.

get.description:
List Event Dates
Get a paginated list of ISO dates (e.g. yyyy-mm-dd) for which events exist.

List Event Entity IDs
Get a paginated list of entity IDs for which events exist.

List Event Entity Types
Get a complete, sorted list of entity types for which events exist.

List Event Log Levels
Get a complete, sorted list of log levels for which events exist.

List Event IDs and Log Messages
List Event IDs and Log Messages, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.
Optionally, filter results with search terms.

parameters.description: Any Match? (default: false; all search terms must match)
parameters.name: any

get.description:
List Events
List Events, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.
Optionally, filter by date, entity ID, or log level.
If no filter is specified, the default is to return up to limit recent Events in reverse order.

post.description:
Create a new Event
Create a new Event.

Location.description: URL of the newly created Event

get.description:
Get Event
Get Event by ID.

delete.description:
Delete Event
Delete and return the specified Event.

head.description:
Event Exists
Check if the specified Event exists.

get.description:
Get Image Labels
Get a list of Image Labels, optionally filtered with search terms.

parameters.description: Any Match? (default: false; all search terms must match)
parameters.name: any

parameters.description: Sort by Value? (not paginated; default: false)
parameters.name: sorted

get.description:
Get Image Statuses
Get a complete list of status codes for which images exist.

Get Image Tags
Get a complete list of tags for which images exist.

List Images
List Images, paging with reverse, limit, and offset. Optionally, filter by status.

post.description:
Create a new Image
Create a new Image.

Location.description: URL of the newly created Image

get.description:
Get Image
Get Image by ID.

put.description:
Update Image
Update the provided, complete Image.

delete.description:
Delete Image
Delete and return the specified Image.
The associated Image file is also deleted.

head.description:
Image Exists
Check if the specified Image exists.

get.description:
Get Image Download URL
Get a pre-signed file download URL for the specified Image.

Find Similar Images
Find similar Images, within the specified perceptual hash distance.

Get Image Upload URL
Get a pre-signed file upload URL for the specified Image.

Get Image Versions
Get Image Versions by ID, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.

Get Image Version
Get Image Version by ID and VersionID.

delete.description:
Delete Image Version
Delete Image Version by ID and VersionID.
Note that the associated Image file is not deleted.

head.description:
Image Version Exists
Check if the specified Image version exists.

get.description:

Optionally, filter results with search terms.

parameters.description: Any Match? (default: false; all search terms must match)
parameters.name: any

parameters.description: Sort by Name? (not paginated; default: false)
parameters.name: sorted

delete.description:

head.description:

get.description:
List Token/User ID pairs
List Token/User ID pairs. This is useful for paging through tokens.

parameters.description: Sort by User ID? (not paginated; default: false)
parameters.name: sorted

get.description:
List Users for which tokens exist
List User IDs and email addresses for which tokens exist.
This is useful for paging through tokens by user.

parameters.description: Any Match? (default: false; all search terms must match)
parameters.name: any

parameters.description: Sort by Email? (not paginated; default: false)
parameters.name: sorted

get.description:
List Tokens
List OAuth Bearer Tokens by User ID (defaults to the Context User).

parameters.description: User ID or Email (defaults to the Context User)
parameters.name: user

400.description: Bad Request (invalid User ID or Email)

403.description: Forbidden (only administrators may read any user's tokens)

post.description:
Create a new Token
Create a new OAuth Bearer Token.

Location.description: URL of the newly created Token

get.description:
Read Token
Read OAuth Bearer Token by ID (e.g. to verify a token has not expired).

403.description: Forbidden (only administrators may read any user's tokens)

delete.description:
Delete Token
Delete OAuth Bearer Token by ID (e.g. to log out).

403.description: Forbidden (only administrators may delete any user's tokens)

head.description:
Token Exists
Check if the specified OAuth Bearer Token exists.

get.description:
Generate the specified number of TUIDs
Generate the specified number of TUIDs, based on the current system time.

post.description:
Generate a new TUID
Generate a new TUID based on current system time and return the TUIDInfo.

Location.description: URL of the newly created TUID

get.description:
Read TUIDInfo for the provided TUID
Parse the provided TUID, returning the TUIDInfo. This can be useful for extracting the timestamp from an ID.

List User Email Addresses
Get a paginated list of email addresses for which users exist.

List User IDs for Email Address
List User IDs for a given email address.

List User IDs and Names
List User IDs and Names, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.
Optionally, filter results with search terms.

parameters.description: Any Match? (default: false; all search terms must match)
parameters.name: any

parameters.description: Sort by Name/Email? (not paginated; default: false)
parameters.name: sorted

get.description:
List User Organization ID/Name pairs
Get a list of Organization ID/Name pairs for which users exist.

parameters.description: Sort by Organization Name? (not paginated; default: false)
parameters.name: sorted

get.description:
List User Roles
Get a list of roles for which users exist.

List User Statuses
Get a list of status codes for which users exist.

List Users
List Users, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.
Optionally, filter by email, organization, role, or status.

post.description:
Create a new User
Create a new User.

Location.description: URL of the newly created User

get.description:
Get User
Get User by ID or email, scrubbing sensitive information if the requester is not an administrator.

403.description: Forbidden (only administrators may read any user)

put.description:
Update User
Update the provided complete User, ensuring that sensitive information is retained.

delete.description:
Delete User
Delete and return the specified User. Attempt to delete their associated Tokens as well, logging errors.

head.description:
User Exists
Check if the specified User exists.

get.description:
List User Versions
Get User Versions by User ID, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.

Get User Version
Get User Version by ID and VersionID, scrubbing sensitive information if the requester is not an administrator.

delete.description:
Delete User Version
Delete and return the specified User Version.

head.description:
User Version Exists
Check if the specified User version exists.

get.description:
Get View Counts
Get a paginated list of view counts by date.

Get the number of views encountered on the specified date.

put.description:
Update View Count
Update the number of views encountered on the specified date.

head.description:
View Count Exists
Check if the specified View Count exists.

get.description:
Get View Dates
Get a list of dates for which views exist.

Get View Device IDs
Get a list of Device IDs for which views exist.

List Views
List Views, paging with reverse, limit, and offset. Optionally, filter by DeviceID or Date.

post.description:
Create a new View
Create a new View with an associated new/updated Device.

get.description:
Get View
Get View by ID.

delete.description:
Delete View
Delete and return the specified View.

head.description:
View Exists
Check if the specified View exists.

description.description: Description is a brief rich text (HTML) description of the destination (optional)

entityId.description: EntityID (a TUID) of the destination resource (optional)

id.description: ID is used for client application state management

images.description: Image(s) for the link destination (optional). Thumbnail images of different sizes may be provided.

shortTitle.description: ShortTitle (anchor tag body), useful for portrait view (optional)

title.description: Title (anchor tag body), useful for landscape view (required)

url.description: URL (anchor tag href), may be relative or absolute (required)

id.description: Section ID used for client application state management

distance.description: The number of differing perceptual hash bits

height.description: Height of the image in pixels

id.description: Image ID of the similar Image

label.description: Image title or alt text, if available

pHash.description: PHash is the DTC perceptual hash of the image

source.description: Source is the URI or file name of the original image

width.description: Width of the image in pixels

height.description: Height of the image in pixels

pHash.description: PHash is the DTC perceptual hash of the image

sourceFileName.description: SourceFileName is the name of the original image

sourceURI.description: SourceURI is the URI of the original image

status.description: Status is the current status of the image

tags.description: Tags are used to group images by topic or category

title.description: Image title, suitable for display as a caption

width.description: Width of the image in pixels

clientName.description: ClientName indicates the application name (Chrome, Googlebot, Edge, etc.)

clientType.description: ClientType indicates the application category (App, Bot, Browser, or Other)

clientVersion.description: ClientVersion indicates the extractVersion of the application, if provided

deviceType.description: DeviceType indicates the general device category (Desktop, Mobile, Tablet, Other)

fields.description: Fields contains parsed/cleaned segments of the User-Agent request header, used for analysis

header.description: Header is the provided User-Agent request header

osName.description: OSName indicates the operating system running on the device (Android, Linux, iOS, macOS, Windows, etc.)

osVersion.description: OSVersion indicates the operating system version, if available

url.description: URL indicates the URL provided, typically for information about a bot/crawler.

id.description: Page ID (paths change, but IDs do not)
